page.title: 08Housing in Great Bromley
page.content: The majority of houses in Great Bromley were built between{1960}and {1985}.{57%}of the houses are of this age.{20%}of the houses were built between{1919}and{1939}.{17%}were built before {World War 1}. The old post office is{400 years old.} {Detached}houses are the most common. 61% of the houses are of this type. 35% are{semi-detached}and only 3% are {terraced.} Almost all the people in the village own their houses, only 8% rent them. The older houses have either thatched or slate roofs. The more modern houses have concrete tiles. {THATCH}: straw {SLATE}: rectangular sheets of hard rock. {CONCRETE}: manmade building material
